column2: ICAO: WAHQ) is an airport in Solo / Surakarta
column4: Indonesia. It is located 14 km north of the city. It was the sole international level airport in Southern Central Java
column5: until the upgrading of the Adisucipto International Airport in Yogyakarta and the Achmad Yani International Airport in Semarang. On 28 January 2008
column6: the airport was closed to all commercial traffic for several hours while the body of former Indonesian President Suharto was transported from Jakarta's Halim Perdanakusuma International Airport. On 2 March 2009
column7: operations moved to the new terminal. Terminal Facilities The new passenger terminal is opened on 2 March 2009. The terminal has three aerobridges with four gates. The airport is able to serve wide body jet like Airbus A330 or Boeing 777. The Airbus A330 is usually operated for Hajj flights in Hajj season or for some extra flight in Ramadan season. The airport terminal has a convenience store (Indomaret)
column9: shopping area and some food counters near the boarding lounge. The old passenger terminal is now used for VVIP flights. The Airport is operated and managed by PT Angkasa Pura I. Technical Specification The airport resides at an elevation of 128 m (419 ft) above mean sea level. It has one runway designated 08/26 with an asphalt surface measuring 2
